title: Question 2
prompt:
Sentence 10: She is organized and flexible, she has a good eye for quality marketing materials.

Which correction should be made to sentence 10?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
On each side of the comma (,) there is a complete sentence. The first sentence is, “She is organized and flexible.” The second sentence is, “She has a good eye for quality marketing materials.” The comma is joining two complete sentences. Joining two complete sentences with a comma is incorrect. One correct way to join two complete sentences into a compound sentence is with a comma followed by a conjunction: and, but, or or. The correct answer two adds the word and, making the sentence read: “She is organized and flexible, and she has a good eye for quality marketing materials.”


Wrong: She is organized and flexible, she has a good eye for quality marketing materials.
Right: She is organized and flexible, and she has a good eye for quality marketing materials.
